intro: Hieracium sangilense, commonly known as the Sangilense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium sangilense is often found in moist or semi-shaded environments, and it can form dense colonies in suitable conditions.
